p: If civilization is to collapse then effects such as conflict, population displacement and famine are likely to be involved. A heatwave, on its own, is unlikely to cause the collapse of civilization, nor even ruin an economy for a decade. It needs social co-factors to do this. For example, a series of heatwaves damaging crop yields and contributing to internal migration has been postulated as contributing to the Syrian civil war that started in 2011 [ 21, 22, 59, 60, 61, 62]. Prolonged heat, especially if in a humid setting, could cause some regions to be completely abandoned [ 63, 64, 65].
